sen.j: 宇治駅（うじえき）は、京都府宇治市宇治宇文字16番地にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located at 16 Uji-Umonji, Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, Uji Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Uji Station, located at 16 Uji-Umonji, Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a company of West Japan Railway (JR-West) Line.
Uji Station, located at 16 Uji-Umonji, Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: 平等院などへの観光や、宇治茶の産地として有名なJRにおける宇治市の代表駅である。
sen.e: It a representative JR station in Uji, a locality famous for tourist attractions such as Byodoin-Temple and as the production center of Uji Tea.
sen.cmt: 宇治市にはJRの他の駅もあり、JRと宇治の位置が入れ違っていると理解して訳しました。
sen.e: It is a representative JR station in Uji, a locality famous for tourist attractions such as Byodoin-Temple and its position as the production center of Uji Tea.
It is a representative JR station in Uji City, a locality famous for tourist attractions such as Byodoin Temple and its position as the production center of Uji Tea.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 元々単式・島式複合型2面3線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅であったが、大幅に増加する利用客への対処、そして奈良線の部分複線化による列車増発、利便性向上のために、2000年8月に、島式2面4線のホームを持つ、立派な橋上駅に改築された。
sen.e: The station originally was an above ground station with a combination of two types of platfroms, one a one-sided platform (track only on one side) and the other a so-called Island type with tracks on both sides, but ｔｏ cope effectively with the sharp increase in the number of passengers, operate more trains as a result of the Nara Line becoming partially double-tracked and to improve on convenience, the station building was reconstructed and completed as a grand over-track structure over two above ground Island platforms and four tracks in August 2000..
sen.cmt: ご指示に反しますが、駅舎が橋上、プラットフォームと線路は地上のままの関係を少し表現しないと実態が伝わりません。日本語で駅と言えば、駅舎、線路、付属所施設等を総合して"駅"を指すものと考えられ、その点を原文は意識していないと思われます。
sen.e: The station originally was an aboveground station with a combination of two types of platforms, one a one-sided platform (track only on one side) and the other a so-called island type with tracks on both sides; however, ｔｏ cope effectively with the sharp increase in the number of passengers, operate more trains as a result of the Nara Line becoming partially double-tracked and achieve more convenience, in August 2000 the station building was reconstructed and completed as a grand over-track structure situated over two aboveground island platforms and four tracks.

The station originally was an aboveground station with a combination of two types of platforms, one a one-sided platform (track only on one side) and the other a so-called island type with tracks on both sides; however, ｔｏ cope effectively with the sharp increase in the number of passengers, operate more trains as a result of the Nara Line becoming partially double-tracked and achieve more convenience, in August 2000 the station building was reconstructed and completed as a grand over-track structure situated over two aboveground island platforms and four tracks.

sen.j: 外観は宇治きっての観光名所でもある、平等院をモチーフとしている。
sen.e: The exterior appearance of the station building depicts and resembles the Byodoin Temple, the foremost tourist attraction of Uji.
The exterior appearance of the station building depicts and resembles Byodoin Temple, the foremost tourist attraction of Uji.
The exterior appearance of the station building depicts and resembles Byodoin Temple, the foremost tourist attraction of Uji.

sen.j: この島式ホームを用いて、快速列車（奈良線みやこ路快速も含む）と普通との緩急接続が図られており、京都方面からの一部の普通列車の折り返し運転が行われている。
sen.e: Using Island type platforms facilitates connections and transfers between swift rapid trains (including Miyakoji rapid train on Nara Line) and slow local trains and some local trains from Kyoto shuttle between the two stations.

Using island-type platforms facilitates connections and transfers between swift rapid trains (including the Miyakoji rapid train on the Nara Line) and slow local trains; additionally, some local trains from Kyoto shuttle between the two stations.

The use of island-type platforms facilitates connections and transfers between swift rapid trains (including the Miyakoji Rapid Service on the Nara Line) and slow local trains; additionally, some local trains from Kyoto double back at this station.
sen.cmt: Miyakoji Rapid Service, double back としました

sen.j: 駅の南口には、休憩施設を備えた宇治市観光協会の案内所があり、観光に便利である。
sen.e: The City Tourist Association's information office at the station's south entrance has a rest station which is proving to be of convenience to tourists.
The City Tourist Association's information office at the station's south entrance has a rest station that is proving to be convenient for tourists.
The Uji City Tourist Association's information office at the station's south entrance has a rest station that is proving to be convenient for tourists.

sen.j: また、2001年に宇治市制50年を記念して設置された茶壺の形をした風変わりな郵便ポストもあり、駅から出てきた観光客から注目されている光景がしばしば見受けられる。
sen.e: Again, the peculiar tea canister shaped ｍａｉｌ box installed in 2001 commemorating Uji City's fiftieth anniversary of becoming a municipaity and other eye-catching scenes aattracing the attention of tourists pouring out of the station can be seen quite often.

Again, the peculiar tea canister-shaped ｍａｉｌ box installed in 2001 to commemorate Uji City's fiftieth anniversary of becoming a municipality and other eye-catching scenes designed to attract the attention of tourists pouring out of the station can readily be seen.

Also, one can readily see the peculiar tea canister-shaped mailbox, which was installed in 2001 to commemorate Uji City's fiftieth anniversary of becoming a municipality to attract the attention of tourists pouring out of the station.
sen.cmt: 一部2バイト文字修正、一部文章削除（原文にないため）

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅であり、ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used at this station as well as PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) Cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cards.
sen.cmt: "スルット関西協議会"の英文を全て大身字にする必要は無いと考えます。
sen.e: The ICOCA and J Through cards can be used at this station as well as PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards.
The ICOCA and J-Thru Cards can be used at this station as well as PiTaPa (Surutto KANSAI Association) Cards subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 奇数番線（1・3番線）が待避線、偶数番線（2・4番線）が本線である。
sen.e: Odd number tracks (#1and #3) are refuge tracks and even number tracks (#2 and #) are main tracks.
Odd-number tracks (nos. 1 and 3) are refuge tracks, and even-number tracks (nos. 2 and 4) are the main tracks.
Odd-number platforms (Platform 1 and 3) are refuge tracks, and even-number platforms (Platform 2 and 4) are the main tracks.

sen.j: 快速を待避する普通は奇数番線に停車する。
sen.e: Local trains taking refuge from rapid trains stop on odd number tracks.
Local trains taking refuge from rapid trains stop on odd-number tracks.
Local trains taking refuge from rapid trains stop on odd-number platforms.

sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約7,173人である。
sen.e: Number of passengers per day in fiscal 2006 was approximately 7,173.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"ではないでしょうか？
sen.e: The number of passengers per day in fiscal 2006 was approximately 7,173.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 7,173 per day in fiscal year 2006.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 宇治市西部を走る近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の大久保駅 (京都府)の約15,192人や、同小倉駅 (京都府)の約9,570人より少なく、宇治市の代表駅と言えるかは疑問であるが、宇治観光の玄関口としては当駅や京阪宇治駅が機能している。
sen.e: The number is less than the approximate 15,192 of Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and approximate 9,570 of Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on Kintetsu Kyoto Line which runs in the western part of Uji City and doubtful if it can be referred to as the representative station of Uji City, but this station and Keihan Uji Station do function as the gateway for Uji sightseeing.

The number is less than the approximate 15,192 of Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and approximate 9,570 of Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, which runs in the western part of Uji City, and there is doubt as to whether it could be referred to as a representative station of Uji City, but this station and Keihan Uji Station do function as gateways for sightseeing in Uji.

The number is less than the approximate 15,192 of Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and approximate 9,570 of Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, which runs in the western part of Uji City, and there is doubt as to whether it could be referred to as a representative station of Uji City, but this station and Keihan Uji Station do function as gateways for sightseeing in Uji.

sen.j: 時期によって混雑度合にやや差があるものの、概ね利用客は多めである。
sen.e: There is some difference in the rate of congestion according to season, but the number of passengers is generally on the larger side.
sen.cmt: "時期"は"時季"ではないかと考え、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: The rate of congestion varies according to the season, but the number of passengers is generally on the higher side.
The rate of congestion varies according to the season, but the number of passengers is generally on the higher side.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道の京阪宇治線にも宇治駅 (京阪)と称する駅があるが、宇治橋を渡り、道路上の距離で約890m北東に離れた場所にある。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Uji Line also has a Uji station but with a 'Keihan'-Keihan Uji Station-located across the Uji-bashi Bridge and some 890m along the road to the northeast.
Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Uji Line also has a Uji station but with a 'Keihan'-Keihan Uji Station-located across the Uji-bashi Bridge and some 890m along the road to the northeast.
Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Uji Line also has a Uji Station (Keihan), which is located across the Uji-bashi Bridge and some 890 m along the road to the northeast.

sen.j: この両駅の名称が同様であるため、JR宇治駅と言うのが一般的となっている。
sen.e: As the name of the two stations are similar, this station is generally referred to as JR Uji Station.
Because the two stations have similar names, this station is generally referred to as JR Uji Station.
Because the two stations have similar names, this station is generally referred to as JR Uji Station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 - 奈良鉄道 桃山駅～玉水駅間延伸時に開業。
sen.e: The station was inaugurated on Jan. 25, 1896 when the extended section on Nara Railway between Momoyama Station and Tamamizu Station became operational.
The station was inaugurated on Jan. 25, 1896 when the extended section of the Nara Railway between Momoyama Station and Tamamizu Station became operational.
January 25, 1896: The station was inaugurated when the extended section of the Nara Railway between Momoyama Station and Tamamizu Station became operational.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 合併により関西鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a station of Kansai Railway by amalgamation on Feb.7, 1905.
It became a station of Kansai Railway due to amalgamation on Feb. 7, 1905.
February 7, 1905: The station became a station of Kansai Railway due to amalgamation.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company nationalized on Oct.1, 1907.
sen.cmt: 国有化法ピリオドでは？
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company was nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907.
October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized.

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道宇治駅に。
sen.e: Became Uji Station of Japanese National Railways.
It became Uji Station of Japanese National Railways.
It became Uji Station of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: It became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）3月16日 - 奈良線の快速運転開始。
sen.e: Rapid trains commenced operations on the Nara Line on March 16, 1991.
Rapid trains commenced operations on the Nara Line on March 16, 1991.
March 16, 1991: Rapid trains commenced operations on the Nara Line.

sen.j: 当初、線内は当駅のみ停車であった。
sen.e: At the outset, this station was the only station at which rapids trains stopped.
At the outset, this station was the only one at which rapids trains stopped.
At the outset, this station was the only one at which rapid trains stopped.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）8月7日 - 橋上駅舎が運用開始する。
sen.e: The over-track station building commenced operations on Aug.7, 2000.
The over-track station building commenced operations on Aug. 7, 2000.
August 7, 2000: The over-track station building commenced operations.

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）3月3日 - 当駅～新田駅 (京都府)間が複線化。
sen.e: The section between this station and Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became double tracked on March 3, 2001.
The section between this station and Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became double-tracked on March 3, 2001.
March 3, 2001: The section between this station and Shinden Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became double-tracked.
